article_title: Tech job cuts to soar in 2014
article_text:
At this pace, job cuts in the tech sector this year will likely be the highest since 2009, when tech job cuts reached 174,629, according to the report. Tech employers slashed the most jobs in 2001 with 695,581 payrolls cut, according to the firm.

Read More Wage growth picking up in some sectors



Computer firms announced the most layoffs during the first half of the year, with 30,002 jobs being cut. The telecommunications industry announced 5,214 job cuts and the electronics industry set to downsize by 5,356 jobs.

The news of the spike in tech layoffs comes ahead of the July payrolls report to be released Friday.

Read MoreThese tech companies have the best pay and perks

—By CNBC's Cadie Thompson. Follow her on Twitter @CadieThompson.

article_metadata.description: Tech companies will be cutting a lot more jobs this year than they have in a long time, according to a recent report.

article_summary:
At this pace, job cuts in the tech sector this year will likely be the highest since 2009, when tech job cuts reached 174,629, according to the report.
The telecommunications industry announced 5,214 job cuts and the electronics industry set to downsize by 5,356 jobs.
The news of the spike in tech layoffs comes ahead of the July payrolls report to be released Friday.
Tech employers slashed the most jobs in 2001 with 695,581 payrolls cut, according to the firm.
